sentences.en: Grandparents tend to cocker up their grandchildren.
sentences.cn: 祖父母们总是很宠爱孙儿.

sentences.en: I take my cocker spaniel to be groomed once a week.
sentences.cn: 我每星期都带我的科卡犬去美容呢.

sentences.en: It's all right, according to the Cocker.
sentences.cn: 按照公认的规则, 这是对的.

sentences.en: My Cocker Spaniel is a merry dog.
sentences.cn: 我的可卡是只欢快的小狗.

sentences.en: The Cocker Spaniel is the smallest member of the Sporting Group.
sentences.cn: 可卡是运动犬组中最小的.

sentences.en: The little cocker spaniel quivering in a cage caught my eye right away.
sentences.cn: 这个小家伙蜷缩在笼子里,立刻吸引了我的目光.

sentences.en: We do not encourage parents to cocker up their children.
sentences.cn: 我们不提倡父母溺爱他们的孩子.

sentences.en: With the plastic leg, Jeff can ski, a bicycle, swim and play cocker.
sentences.cn: 有了这根义肢, 杰夫可以滑雪, 骑自行车, 游泳,打曲棍球.

phrases.tran_cn: n. 一种英国的小猎犬

trans.tran_cn: 西班牙长耳猎犬，喜好或举办斗鸡的人
娇养, 溺爱, 放纵
